odisseo.initial_condition module#

odisseo.initial_condition.Plummer_sphere(key, config, params)[source]#

Create initial conditions for a Plummer sphere. The sampling of velocities is done by inverse fitting the cumulative distribution function of the Plummer sphere.

Parameters:

  • key (jax.random.PRNGKey) – Random key.

  • config (NamedTuple) – Configuration NamedTuple containing the number of particles (N_particles).

  • params (NamedTuple) –

    Parameters NamedTuple containing: Plummer_a : float

    Scale length of the Plummer sphere.

    Gfloat

    Gravitational constant.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - positions : jnp.array

Array of shape (N_particles, 3) representing the positions of the particles.

  • velocitiesjnp.array

    Array of shape (N_particles, 3) representing the velocities of the particles.

  • massesjnp.array

    Array of shape (N_particles,) representing the masses of the particles.

Return type:

tuple

odisseo.initial_condition.Plummer_sphere_multiprocess(mass, config, params)[source]#
Parameters:

  • mass (float) – The total mass of the Plummer sphere.

  • config (NamedTuple) – Configuration NamedTuple containing the number of particles (N_particles).

  • params (NamedTuple) –

    Parameters NamedTuple containing: Plummer_a : float

    Scale length of the Plummer sphere.

    Gfloat

    Gravitational constant.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - positions : jnp.array

Array of shape (N_particles, 3) representing the positions of the particles.

  • velocitiesjnp.array

    Array of shape (N_particles, 3) representing the velocities of the particles.

  • massesjnp.array

    Array of shape (N_particles,) representing the masses of the particles.

Return type:

tuple

odisseo.initial_condition.ic_two_body(mass1: float, mass2: float, rp: float, e: float, config, params)[source]#

Create initial conditions for a two-body system.

By default, the two bodies will be placed along the x-axis at the closest distance rp. Depending on the input eccentricity, the two bodies can be in a circular (e < 1), parabolic (e = 1), or hyperbolic orbit (e > 1).

Parameters:

  • mass1 (float) – Mass of the first body [nbody units].

  • mass2 (float) – Mass of the second body [nbody units].

  • rp (float) – Closest orbital distance [nbody units].

  • e (float) – Eccentricity.

  • config (NamedTuple) – Configuration NamedTuple.

  • params (NamedTuple) – Parameters NamedTuple.

Returns:

  • pos (jnp.ndarray) – Positions of the particles.

  • vel (jnp.ndarray) – Velocities of the particles.

  • mass (jnp.ndarray) – Masses of the particles.

odisseo.initial_condition.inclined_circular_velocity(position, v_c, inclination)[source]#

Convert circular velocity from an inclined orbit into Cartesian components.

Parameters:

  • position (jnp.ndarray) – (x, y, z) position of the Plummer sphere.

  • v_c (float) – Circular velocity (km/s).

  • inclination (float) – Inclination angle in radians.

Returns:

velocity – (v_x, v_y, v_z) velocity components.

Return type:

jnp.ndarray

odisseo.initial_condition.sample_position_on_sphere(key, r_p, num_samples=1)[source]#

Sample uniform positions on a sphere of radius r_p.

Parameters:

  • key (jax.random.PRNGKey) – JAX random key for sampling.

  • r_p (float) – Radius of the sphere.

  • num_samples (int) – Number of samples to generate.

Returns:

positions – Sampled positions (num_samples, 3).

Return type:

jnp.ndarray
